description: Based on a popular web-released manga series by Hidekazu Himaruya, this has been described as a "cynical gag" story set in Europe in the years between WW1 and WW2 (1918-1939), using exaggerated caricatures of the different nationalities as portrayed by a gaggle of bishōnen. For example, the Italia Veneziano character is into pasta and women. The Deutsche (German) bishi loves potatoes and sausages, and Nippon is an otaku boy. Installments of the manga have jumped back and forth in setting from the ancient times to modern-day geopolitics. The manga's title comes the Japanese words for "useless" (hetare) and Italy (Italia).

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Educational
tags.description: Primary aim is to educate the audience.

tags.name: Cute Boys Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around male characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Anachronism
tags.description: Prominently features elements that are out of place in the historical period the work takes place in, particularly modern elements in a historical setting.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Maids
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a maid.

tags.name: Economics
tags.description: Centers around the field of economics.

tags.name: Astronomy
tags.description: Relating or centered around the study of celestial objects and phenomena, space, or the universe.

A Japanese voice actor. He is known for his Kansai accent in some roles. In 2010, he won the Seiyuu Award for Best Personality.

Has a [YouTube channel](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCJQb0Pou939pDubqrvTSRSA/) where he plays video games and phone apps with [Katsuyuki Konishi](https://anilist.co/staff/95020/).

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/marchimark) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/jamiemarchi/)

An American voice actress, ADR director, and script writer who works for Funimation and Sentai Filmworks. She grew up in Oklahoma and graduated from the University of Oklahoma with a bachelor's degree in theater, starting her professional acting career in 2000. She married fellow actor Sean T. Perez on August 8, 1999, and they divorced on November 21, 2005. Jamie has two step-daughters. Her younger half-brother, [Jean-Luc Hester](https://anilist.co/staff/104094), is also a voice actor.

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"
Scott Sager is mostly known as the ADR Engineer/Director at Funimation, but had a minor role in Voice Acting for Blue Gender, Strike Witches, and Hetalia Axis Powers.

__Cousin:__ [Aaron Dismuke](https://anilist.co/staff/95254/Aaron-Dismuke)

__Justin Ryan Cook__ is an American voice actor, producer, line producer, ADR director and enginner who works for FUNimation.
